comments:
I have a vanilla bugzilla 2.22 install with no customization.

I have added it to the task repositories, and the settings validate; however, I am unable to add a new task or query the server. The message says it is unable to get products. It also does not work on other repositories that I used to connect to in older versions of mylar.

In the log file is the following exception:



!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 1 0 2006-08-18 10:01:14.093
!MESSAGE Failed to retrieve products from server

Have you tried the trouble shooting tips here:http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Bugzilla_Connector_troubleshooting ?

Created an attachment (id=48185)
Output of the /config.cgi?ctype=rdf url
The FAQ did not help. I attached the output of the <your-repository-url>/config.cgi?ctype=rdf .
Could you go to the same url but do a 'view source' on the resulting page and attach that as well? Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=48191)
source output of the previous attachment

Okay it doesn't look like the rdf output is problematic. Perhaps the stream is getting terminated prematurely.  Could you give me some details about your os and jdk version? Is the web server using https/certificates?

The webserver is not using https.

My jdk is:
java version "1.5.0_07"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_07-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode)

I am using redhat enterprise WS 4 update 4.

I am using eclipse 3.2.
Okay thanks and I assume you're using Mylar release 0.6.1? Bumping up to P1.

From the rdf config you posted it appears as though your urlbase isn't set. I found a bug in our parser that was corrupting the config when the urlbase (rdf:about) value is empty. The work around is to set the urlbase in the bugzilla server parameters to something. Can you confirm that your urlbase was/is in fact empty in the bugzilla parameters?
That was my problem. Sorry about that; I was checking the wrong server when I verified that parameter.
No worries, thanks for confirming. The fix for handling an empty urlbase will be in the next release (this evening or Monday I believe).

traces.message: Attribute name "rdf:about" associated with an element type "bz:installation" must be followed by the ' = ' character.
